snippet: On the eve of a United Nations vote that could hold leaders of North Korea accountable for rights violations, diplomats said that they had rarely seen such frenetic action from the nation.
abstract: Human rights activists and diplomats at United Nations say that they have rarely seen such frenetic action on part of North Korea in response to looming UN vote on human rights that could lead to criminal charges; country, in effort to stop resolution, has released prisoners, but denies an ex-captive's ordeal.
lead_paragraph: On the eve of a United Nations vote that could hold leaders of North Korea accountable for rights violations, diplomats said that they had rarely seen such frenetic action from the nation.

headline.main: North Korea Acts to Stop U.N. Resolution on Rights
headline.print_headline: North Korea Acts to Stop U.N. Resolution on Rights

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
